page.title: 14LICHFIELD HEALTH CENTRE
page.content: {The Greenhill Health Centre} is a building with doctors'surgeries, clinics and a dentist.There are eleven doctors and three trainees;each doctor has 3000 patients on his roll.The doctors also attend the two local hospitals:Victoria and St.Michael's. The centre has many clinics;allergy, diabetic,eye,ear,baby,'well-woman', family planning,anti-natal,speech therapy and chiropody.There is also a pharmacy to supply prescriptions. Twenty receptionists work at the centre of whom six are fulltime.There is a nursing officer to arrange the duties of the nurses,and an administrator to deal with staff salaries and the ordering of supplies. The centre was built in 1981 and officially opened by the Lord Bishop of Lichfield.
